title:
Extinction behaviour for a mutually interacting continuous-state
  population dynamics
authors: Jie Xiong, Xu Yang, Xiaowen Zhou
abstract:
We consider a system of two stochastic differential equations (SDEs) with
negative two-way interactions driven by Brownian motions and spectrally
positive $\alpha$-stable random measures. Such a SDE system can be identified
as a Lotka-Volterra type population model. We find close to sharp conditions
for one of the population to go extinct or extinguishing.
